nodes.bodyText:
We got the suggestion to use the hdfs cli instead of s3 to upload/download.
It was my understanding that we don't have to specify the region in that case, the hdfs configurations should take care of things?

@keyki  AWS CLI would depend on permissions granted to the instance profile of the datalake node which is currently LOG_ROLE. Grating more permissions to LOG_ROLE was not a good idea.
With this change, we will be using hdfs client to write to S3. This uses S3a. All the services which to S3, internally use S3a. With the configuration we are using, S3a fetches the region information of the bucket and then constructs the request accordingly.
I'm resolving this conversation, given that we have a reason and there's been no further concern.
we can not really remove pillar property because then the older clusters will not work .

nodes.bodyText:
here are were are creating a directory and accessing directly. S3 provides an eventual guarantee.
In short, if you create a directory and try to write to it immediately, it might fail.
we use S3 guard to handle this issue with S3. S3 guard tracks all the operations and changes the metadata.
I'm not sure if S3 guard is enabled by default. Is there anything that has to be done for it. Can you check with @risdenk  on this?
